So today, the Senate is moving forward on the border crisis. The Senate Appropriations Committee just approved a funding package with overwhelming bipartisan support. This a big step toward finally helping our overstretched agencies.

For seven weeks, House Democrats have delayed the emergency funding that is badly needed for the humanitarian crisis on our southern border. They have chosen to pick political fights with President Trump rather than get serious about finding compromise solutions.

Let there be no doubt: While the United States does not seek conflict, we must be prepared to decisively defeat our adversaries if conflict is forced upon us. We need to remain engaged, prepared, and powerful.

The National Defense Authorization Act is crucial, bipartisan legislation that will help maintain and expand our alliances and partnerships around the globe, as well as our own ability to stand firm amidst growing global unrest.
